results.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Studio Ghibli, Tokuma Shoten and Top Craft
results.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

results.title: Greetings
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Charles Hirsch and West End Film
results.brief_description: A film very representative of the era and place in which it was made - New York late 1960s. “Greetings”, directed by Brian De Palma, is about three hip intellectual young men who come up with some novel ideas on how to avoid the draft that will send them to the conflict in Vietnam. Paul (Jonathan Warden), Jon (Robert De Niro) and Lloyd (Geritt Graham) present as gay and extreme right-wingers to the army all the while trying their best to seduce women to keep themselves occupied. This is a witty and satirical view of American culture at the time and is more a series of fun episodes in the protagonists’ lives than a straight-forward narrative. Co-written by Brian De Palma and Charles Hirsch and also edited by De Palma. Music by ‘The Children of Paradise’.

results.title: The Mother (2003)
results.creator_credit: Roger Michell, Kevin Loader and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Having spent her whole life in the ‘accepted’ role of wife and mother, elderly May appears distant and unaffectionate. Not very loved by either of her two adult children, May and husband Toots travel to London for a visit with the family. On the sudden death of her husband, May has an affair with a man half her age, who is also her daughter’s boyfriend. The film explores contemporary life in London and the way families live with the dynamic of demands of work and relationships. It also proves age is no reason for loss of sexual desire but what about moral ethics?

results.title: Insomnia (2002)
results.creator_credit: Christopher Nolan, Andrew A Kosove, Broderick Johnson, Edward McDonnell, Paul Junger Witt, Alcon Entertainment and Witt Thomas Section Eight Productions
results.brief_description: A police detective (Al Pacino) wanted for questioning by Internal Affairs flies to Alaska to assist in a murder enquiry. In pursuit of the suspect in deep fog, his partner is shot and the accident leads the murderer (Robin Williams) to blackmail the detective. Due to the Midnight Sun and the stress of the situation he finds himself in, the detective suffers from insomnia which impacts on his judgement in dealing with his partner’s death. An earnest young police detective (Hilary Swank) is thorough in her investigative techniques and discovers the truth. Based on the film “Insomnia” directed by Erik Skjoldbjaerg, this all-star version is just as compelling. Cast includes Martin Donovan, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Thunderstruck
results.creator_credit: Darren Ashton, Jodi Matterson, Film Finance Corporation Australia, ICON, Showtime and Sony Music Australia
results.brief_description: Four mates go on the road with a mission - to scatter the ashes of a friend on the grave of Bon Scott, original frontman for rock band AC/DC. Struggling in their own way with adulthood, the lads get the band back together to live out their promise made to each other 12 years ago - that should any of them die they would be buried out West next to Scott. Living out this pact is harder than they think with a lot of obstacles getting in the way on their life-changing journey. Written and directed by Darren Ashton (co-writer Shaun Angus Hall). Cast includes Damon Gameau, Stephen Curry, Ryan Johnson, Callan Mulvey, Sam Worthington.

results.title: Volcano high = Whasango
results.creator_credit: Tae-kyun Kim, Cha Sung-jai, Cinema Service, Media Asia Group and Sidus
results.brief_description: Peer group pressure at High School is on a whole other level when the students go to a fantastical school for those good in martial arts. Students and teachers alike seem to be gifted but there is the usual pecking order of the leaders and the losers. Onto his ninth school, the new boy nicknamed ‘transfer’ is set upon by the nasty leader of the schoolyard, Ryang, but he is surprised by the new boy’s power. Teenagers battle it out in this mythical and fun filled fight film full of whimsy and slapstick.

results.title: The Quiet American (2001)
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Steffan Ahrenberg, William Horberg, IMF (DE), Intermedia and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Thomas Fowler (Michael Caine) is an embittered British Journalist working in Vietnam (then Indochina), covering the political situation. A man known for his professional objectivity and honesty, Fowler’s personal life is a fiasco. Involved with a local woman, Phuong (Do Thi Hai Yen), whom he loves, Fowler is married to a strictly religious woman back in England who refuses to divorce him. Into their lives steps an enigmatic American man (Brendan Fraser). The American man falls for Phuong, and asks only that Phuong be given the opportunity to choose between the men and (like Indochina), resolve her destiny. In danger of losing Phuong to the American, Fowler is drawn into a suspicious and venomous state, convinced that the American is supplying explosives to non-Communist troops. “The Quiet American” leaves the more contentious political elements of Graham Greene’s novel to languish in favour of highlighting the personal grief of a middle-aged man in crisis. This version directed by Phillip Noyce is a remake of the 1958 film directed by Joseph L. Mankiewicz. Filmed on location in Vietnam and Fox Studios, Sydney.

results.title: Year of the Horse: Neil Young and Crazy Horse live
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, L Johnson and Shakey Pictures
results.brief_description: Spanning a career of more that three decades, legendary performer Neil Young and his band Crazy Horse ‘crank it up’ in rockin’ live concert documentary footage of an extensive tour in 1996. Watch interviews with the band: guitarist Frank “Poncho” Sampedro, bassist Billy Talbot, drummer Ralph Molina and singer/guitarist Neil Young. Mixed with intimate back-stage and ‘on-the-road’ moments from the 1970s through to the 1990s, director Jim Jarmusch takes the viewer on a musical pilgrimage discovering the intensity of live performance and staying-power of these classic rock compositions by Young and the Horse. Shot on Super8, 16mm and Hi-8 Video.

results.title: In America
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Fox Searchlight and Hell's Kitchen
results.brief_description: From the director of “My Left Foot” and “In the name of the Father” comes a moving portrait of an Irish immigrant family trying to establish a new life in the US after a devastating tragedy. The father (Paddy Considine) is a struggling actor who ends up driving a taxi at night to make a living while the mother (Samantha Morton) raises their two adorable girls (played by real life sisters Sarah and Emma Bolger) while working at a nearby ice-cream parlour. The eldest of the two girls uses her home video camera as a way to document their current life and deal with the past - much of the strength and delight of the film comes from the roles of the children. Set in New York City in a dilapidated apartment building they share with drug dealers, pimps and other poor families, the girls be-friend a neighbour Mateo (Djimon Hounsou) who provides the family with a new outlook and helps them face their grief, while he deals with his own mortality. The loosely autobiographical script is based on Jim Sheridan’s life and was co-written with his two daughters Naomi and Kirsten Sherdian. Nominated for three Academy Awards in 2003.

results.title: Koyaanisqatsi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Reggio and I R E
results.brief_description: Ko-Yaa-Nis-Katsi (from the Hopi language) is a panoramic roller coaster of life that makes you scream but hang on. A spellbinding, staggering non-narrative film that soars across the United States in search of vistas both natural and man-made. Much of the photography is in slow motion and time-lapse edited in such away as to produce an entirely different perspective to everyday reality. With cinematography by Ron Fricke and mesmerising music by Philip Glass, the film juxtaposes distortion with truth producing quite often alarming results. It is divided into five segments as follows: 1. Crazy life. 2. Life in turmoil. 3. Life out of balance. 4. Life disintegrating. 5. A state of life that calls for another way of living. Also available on VHS [307953]

It is divided into five segments as follows: 1. Crazy life. 2. Life in turmoil. 3. Life out of balance. 4. Life disintegrating. 5. A state of life that calls for another way of living.
